about.description:
The purpose of the pyeviews package is to make it easier for EViews and Python
to talk to each other, so Python programmers can use the econometric engine of
EViews directly from Python.
about.summary: Data import/export and EViews function calls from Python

name: pyeviews
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set name = "pyeviews" %}
{% set version = "1.0.1" %}

package:
  name: {{ name|lower }}
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  url: https://pypi.io/packages/source/{{ name[0] }}/{{ name }}/{{ name }}-{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 36fe3ffaed5f66ade40e7cbd1b695f582c862cfa88b5cb435ed681b2abc50545

build:
  number: 2
  script: "{{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . -vv"
  skip: True  # [not win]
  
requirements:
  build: 
  host:
    - python
    - pip
    - setuptools
  run:
    - python
    - numpy
    - pandas
    - comtypes
    - setuptools

test:
  imports:
    - pyeviews

about:
  home: http://github.com/bexer/pyeviews
  license: GPL-3.0-only
  license_family: GPL
  license_file: LICENSE.txt
  summary: 'Data import/export and EViews function calls from Python'

  description: |
    The purpose of the pyeviews package is to make it easier for EViews and Python 
    to talk to each other, so Python programmers can use the econometric engine of 
    EViews directly from Python.
  dev_url: https://github.com/bexer/pyeviews
    
extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - bexer
smithy_version:
No azure token. Create a token and
put it in ~/.conda-smithy/azure.token
3.6.16
